intro: Psychopterys mcvaughii, commonly known as the McVaugh's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit, narrow leaves, and clusters of small yellow flowers. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. The plant's botanical features make it well adapted to dry climates and poor soil conditions.
